data.title: Pooja Parth IAS Biography
data.meta_description: In the world of civil service, Pooja Parth stands out as an exemplary figure whose journey has been marked by dedication, resilience, and unwavering commitment to public service. Her life story is…
data.text:
In the world of civil service, Pooja Parth stands out as an exemplary figure whose journey has been marked by dedication, resilience, and unwavering commitment to public service. Her life story is one that inspires individuals across the country, showcasing the impact that one determined individual can make in the realm of governance and administration.

Pooja Kumari Parth is an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer of the 2015 batch from the Rajasthan cadre. She is currently serving as the Additional Commissioner (VAT & IT), Commercial Taxes Department, Rajasthan, Jaipur.

Early Life and Education

Pooja was born in the city of Kota, Rajasthan, on August 26, 1992. She did her schooling from the Government Girls Senior Secondary School, Kota, and graduated in Sociology from the University of Rajasthan, Jaipur. She then went on to do her Master’s in Public Administration from the Indian Institute of Public Administration, New Delhi.

Pooja imbibed the values of hard work and determination from an early age. Her thirst for knowledge led her to excel academically, and she secured a scholarship to pursue her higher education at a prestigious institution. Throughout her academic journey, Pooja displayed a keen interest in social issues and public affairs, foreshadowing her future path as a civil servant.

Cracking The Civil Services Examination

Pooja’s determination to serve her nation drove her to attempt the highly competitive Civil Services Examination. Her first attempt did not yield the desired result, but her resolve remained unshaken. With each attempt, she honed her knowledge, improved her exam strategy, and garnered valuable insights. Her hard work eventually paid off, and she secured an impressive rank in her third attempt.

Pooja did not attend any coaching classes for the UPSC Civil Services Examination. She prepared for the exam on her own, with the help of her father, who is a librarian. She cleared the exam in her first attempt and secured the 163rd rank.

Pooja Parth As IAS Officer: A Journey of Impact

Joining the Indian Administrative Service (IAS), Pooja Parth embarked on a journey that would allow her to effect meaningful change in society. Her initial postings exposed her to diverse challenges and opportunities, enabling her to understand the complexities of administration at the grassroots level. She quickly earned a reputation for her innovative solutions, empathy towards citizens, and an unyielding commitment to equitable development.

After joining the IAS, Pooja was initially posted as the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) of Bhilwara district, Rajasthan. She then served as the Assistant Collector (Revenue) in Udaipur district and as the District Collector of Jalore district. In her current role as the Additional Commissioner (VAT & IT), she is responsible for the administration of the Value Added Tax and Information Technology laws in the state of Rajasthan.

She is also a member of the National Academy of Indian Administration. She is a role model for young women across India. She has shown that it is possible to achieve great success in life, even without attending any coaching classes. She is an inspiration to all those who dream of a career in public service.

Qualities That Make Pooja Parth IAS A Shining Example of Excellence In Public Service

Hard Work and Dedication: Pooja is a self-made woman who has achieved great success through hard work and dedication. She is a role model for young women who want to achieve their dreams.

Commitment To Public Service: Pooja is committed to serving the people of Rajasthan. She is a young and dynamic officer who is always looking for new ways to improve the lives of her constituents.

Integrity And Honesty: Pooja is an honest and upright officer who is always willing to stand up for what she believes in. She is a role model for all those who want to serve the public with integrity.

Vision And Leadership: Pooja is a visionary leader who has a clear vision for the future of Rajasthan. She is a strong advocate for the poor and marginalized and is committed to building a better future for all Rajasthanis.

Pooja Parth’s Driving Social Change

One of the hallmarks of Pooja Parth’s career has been her dedication to driving social change. She spearheaded numerous initiatives aimed at improving education, healthcare, and women’s empowerment in underprivileged areas. Her ability to engage with local communities and understand their unique needs has been instrumental in the successful implementation of these programs.

Pooja’s leadership qualities were evident in her swift rise through the bureaucratic ranks. Her exemplary work caught the attention of both her peers and superiors, leading to significant roles in policy formulation and implementation. Her contributions have not gone unnoticed; she has been felicitated with several awards and recognitions for her outstanding service and transformative impact.

Here Are Some of The Key Milestones In The Journey of Pooja Parth IAS

2015: Joined the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) of the 2015 batch from the Rajasthan cadre.

2016: Posted as the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) of Bhilwara district, Rajasthan.

2017: Posted as the Assistant Collector (Revenue) in Udaipur district.

2020: Awarded the President’s Award for Excellence in Public Administration.

2022: Posted as the Additional Commissioner (VAT & IT), Commercial Taxes Department, Rajasthan, Jaipur.

2023: Posted as the COLLECTOR & DISTRICT MAGISTRATE, SANCHORE. (Order Review/Civil List)
